title: Clergy
summary: Clergy are formal leaders within established religions.  Their roles and functions vary in different religious traditions, but usually involve presiding over specific rituals and teaching their religion's doctrines and practices. Some of the terms used for individual clergy are clergyman, clergywoman, and churchman. Less common terms are cleric, churchwoman, and clergyperson,  while clerk in holy orders has a long history but is rarely used.
